main event: A star-like object, blue to fiery brown in color, was observed making a fast, zig-zag motion in the sky over Wild Rice, North Dakota on July 23, 1957.
interesting points: The object appeared to be longer than usual when first seen.
The object made a zig-zag motion, twice the length of a full moon, and then disappeared.
The object did not have the normal characteristics of a conventional aircraft.
The observation was made by Mr. and Mrs. Wild Rice and reported to the Air Force.
The report includes various measurements and observations related to the sighting.
sighted object: a star-like object, blue to fiery brown in color
